body_html:
Not everything is supported in scripting.

Sure but would you really want to write a completely separate implementation of a function just because you might be disabling the JIT?

I really don’t think that anyone should have any logic in their programs that depend on the JIT being enabled or not. After all it’s a flag that’s supposed to make debugging easier, but if your program is taking different paths depending on this mode, then you’re not really inspecting the same thing.

body:
> Not everything is supported in scripting.

Sure but would you really want to write a completely separate implementation of a function just because you might be disabling the JIT?

I really don’t think that anyone should have any logic in their programs that depend on the JIT being enabled or not. After all it’s a flag that’s supposed to make debugging easier, but if your program is taking different paths depending on this mode, then you’re not really inspecting the same thing.
